title: Harris targets middle class with an economic plan focused on the cost of living
summary: The Democratic candidate outlined her policy on Friday in North Carolina, in a resolutely optimistic speech focused on food prices, health care, housing and children.

title: Trump hurls fresh insults at 'lunatic' Harris as she gains popularity in the polls
summary: Republicans and Trump advisers – concerned by Harris's energized campaign – have publicly urged him to stick to the issues and lay off the personal attacks, but the former president has shown no sign of changing his populist, confrontational style. Criticizing a portrait of Harris on the cover of Time magazine, Trump insisted he was 'much better looking than her.'

title: Venezuelan opposition vows to fight 'to the end'
summary: People gathered in several cities in Venezuela and as far afield as Spain, Belgium and Australia in response to a call by opposition leader Maria Corina Machado to join a 'Protest for the Truth' to intensify pressure on Maduro to concede what she and others say was an overwhelming win for opposition candidate Edmundo Gonzalez Urrutia in July 28 polls.

title: Ukraine ready to join International Criminal Court
summary: After years of debate, Kyiv may soon ratify the Rome Statute, thereby fulfilling one of the European Union's demands.

title: Israel-Gaza negotiations: Washington steps up efforts to reach agreement
summary: The US has presented a new draft text for the implementation of a truce between Israel and Hamas and to avoid a regional war. But there are still many stumbling blocks, and discussions are expected to continue in Cairo.

title: For the Cyclades, mass tourism is a financial windfall, but it's also a cause for concern
summary: In Amorgos, Greece, islanders fear that their island is going to follow the same path as Santorini or Mykonos, overwhelmed by visitors.

title: Lithuanian director Saulé Bliuvaité's 'Toxic' wins the Golden Leopard at Locarno
summary: The festival's jury honored a majority of women, with South Korean actress Kim Min-hee receiving one of the acting prizes for her role in Hong Sang-soo's 'By the Stream.'

title: Fire breaks out at London's Somerset House, home to priceless works by Van Gogh, Cezanne
summary: Heavy smoke and flames that could be seen coming from the roof around noon had died down a few hours later as firefighters poured water on it from the buckets on ladder trucks.

title: 10 killed in Israeli strike on southern Lebanon
summary: The almost daily exchanges of fire between Hezbollah and the Israeli army over the past 10 months have intensified with the assassination of the political leader of Hamas in Teheran on July 31, blamed on Israel.

title: The wolf returns to France and so does the illegal practice of poaching
summary: Although there are no official estimates in France, several cases show that these illegal acts are multiplying in areas where wolves have recolonized.

title: Germany's Free Democratic Party is now promoting a 'car policy'
summary: Losing ground, the Liberals are promoting the return of the car to the city center, even if it means increasing tensions within the ruling coalition.

title: Ligue 1 kicks off with 4-1 Paris win over Le Havre
summary: It was a comfortable win for the first match of the Parisian club's post-Mbappé era.

title: Prospera, the eccentric private libertarian enclave in Honduras
summary: Investors have taken advantage of Honduran law to build a private city with its own rules, a utopia for those advocating the abolition of the state – a project that has proved divisive.

title: Gaza reports first case of polio in 25 years
summary: Health officials say the disease was detected in a 10-month-old baby. It spreads through contaminated water and is mostly dangerous for children.

title: Mpox virus: Fears of global spread of a new, more contagious and more lethal viral strain
summary: Two cases of mpox have been identified outside Africa since the WHO declared the disease a public health emergency of international concern.

title: The 'Akon City' mirage fades in Senegal
summary: Launched in 2020, the American singer Akon's futuristic city project has come to a standstill. At the end of June, he received a formal warning notice that could bury the undertaking for good.

title: 'The British far right is a constellation of tiny groups, with no real organization or hierarchy'
summary: The radical, racist right was thought to have been marginalized in Britain since Brexit. It is still there and making its presence known on the streets. Although it is not unified within a predominant structure, it is spreading on social media.

title: On Locarno's screens, a disquieting selection features the body in all its states
summary: Despite a difficult period for auteur films, the Swiss festival maintained its demanding program.

title: Kamala Harris and Tim Walz targeted by an unusually violent online smear campaign
summary: Since late July, the new Democratic candidate and her running mate have been the subject of an avalanche of disinformation from Donald Trump and his supporters, mixing sexism, transphobia and racism.

title: Blinken heads back to Middle East as Gaza truce hopes rise
summary: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken flew out of Andrews Air Force Base after two days of ceasefire talks urged by President Joe Biden brokered with Egypt and Qatar wrapped up in the Qatari capital Doha. US officials said they made progress and offered a proposal to bridge gaps between Israel and Hamas.

title: US inflation below 3% in a boon for Kamala Harris
summary: Inflation in the country fell back to 2.9% in July, its lowest level since March 2021. The figure helps the Democrats defend their record.

title: Alain Delon, enduring star of French cinema, has died
summary: The embodiment of the actor par excellence and a personality as much as an artist, Alain Delon lived his art with an unparalled intensity. He died at the age of 88.

title: Kamala Harris and the national destiny of an uncompromising prosecutor
summary: 'The irresistible rise of Kamala Harris' (2/2). Elected San Francisco district attorney in 2003, the Democratic candidate for the White House showed her strength of character and commitment to defending the law in California.

title: Haiti's justice system powerless to deal with gangs
summary: Inadequately funded, Haiti's courts have been operating at a snail's pace since armed gangs destroyed the Port-au-Prince courthouse. The government is seeking to relaunch the penal reform plan to combat the prevailing impunity in the country.

title: 'There's more to life than buying a car; there's something deeper': Young practicing believers share their stories
summary: In a materialistic society that views faith as archaic, they have embraced religion. For these young people of all denominations, the revisited practice involves new technologies and a more flexible approach to dogma.

title: Alain Delon's children wage public war for more than just movie star's inheritance
summary: There is no love lost between the three children of the famed French actor, who was weakened by a stroke and a serious illness. Anthony, Anouchka, and Alain-Fabien have been at each other's throats since the start of the year, with rampant insults, sordid accusations, and lawsuits.

title: Alain Delon in ‘Le Monde’: talent, family rifts and political views
summary: As Alain Delon's health has recently declined, his three children have begun to fight over his inheritance. Here is how Le Monde covered the star actor over the years.

title: Alain Delon's death: The muted ambivalence of the man and the actor
summary: Cop and thug, grace and violence, progressive acts and reactionary ideology, throughout his career and life, the actor, who died at the age of 88, walked a tightrope.

title: Ukrainian forces claim to hold many Russian soldiers captured in the Kursk region
summary: Moscow has reportedly contacted Kyiv to initiate talks about a prisoner exchange. Eleven days after the start of its offensive on Russian territory, Ukraine continues to apply pressure on the Kremlin.
